info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 25 at 6:55AM CDT until June 25 at 7:15AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 AM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN MERCER AND SOUTHWESTERN HENRY COUNTIES... At 655 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Henry County Fairgrounds to North Henderson, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Cambridge, Woodhull, Alpha, Andover, North Henderson, New Windsor, Lynn Center, Osco, Henry County Fairgrounds, Ophiem and Ulah. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
